content.text:
# Ancient Diocese of Vabres__disambig_1

Vabres Cathedral
The former French Catholic diocese of Vabres existed from 1317 to the French Revolution. After the Concordat of 1801 its territory was divided between the diocese of Cahors and the diocese of Montpellier.[http://www.catholic-hierarchy.org/diocese/dv505.html Vabres (Diocese) [Catholic-Hierarchy]]
The Benedictine Abbey of Vabres, founded in 862 by Raymond I, Count of Toulouse, was raised to episcopal rank in 1317, and its diocesan territory was taken from the southeastern portion of the Diocese of Rodez.[http://www.newadvent.org/cathen/13107a.htm Catholic Encyclopedia: Rodez] Its see was Vabres Cathedral.
Bishops

*Raymond d'Olargues (1329–1347)
*Pierre d'Aigrefeuille (1347–1349)
*Guy de Ventadour (1349–1352)

*Mathieu Proti (1409–1413)
*Guillaume de Bastidos (1413–1421)
*Jean de Pierre (1421–1453)
*Bernard de Blanc (1453–1485)
*Antoine Pierre de Narbonne (1486–1499)
*Louis de Narbonne (1499–1518)

*Thomas de Lauro (1585–1593)

*Isaac Hubert (1645–1668)
*Louis de la Vermhe Montemard de Tressan (1669–1671)
*Louis de Baradat (1673–1710)
*Charles-Alexandre le Filleul de la Chapelle (1710–1764)
*Jean de la Croix de Castrie (1764–1796)
